intro: Tephrosia bibracteolata subsp. bibracteolata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf tephrosia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters. The plant features compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces yellow flowers in clusters. It is characterized by its distinctive bracts, which are small leaf-like structures at the base of the inflorescence. This species is often found in dry, open woodlands and is adapted to seasonal rainfall patterns.
